Gain Advantage on Melee Strength Attack Rolls until the end of your turn, but enemies also have Advantage against you.
Can only be used on first attack.
Affected entity has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Melee Strength <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>. Enemies have Advantage on Attack Rolls against it.
Must be the first attack of your turn.

Deals an additional [1] damage with melee strength weapons.

Has Resistance to physical damage, and Advantage on Strength Checks and Saving Throws.

Cannot cast or concentrate on spells.

Deals an additional [1] damage with melee strength weapons. You can make a single melee weapon attack as a bonus action on each of your turns.

Has Resistance to physical damage, and Advantage on Strength Checks and Saving Throws.

Cannot cast or concentrate on spells.
Disadvantage on ability checks, Speed halved
Disadvantage on ability checks, Speed halved, Disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws
Disadvantage on ability checks, Speed halved, Disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws, Hit point maximum halved
Disadvantage on ability checks, Speed halved, Disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws, Hit point maximum halved, Speed reduced to 0

If you drop to 0 <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit point</LSTag> while <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Enraged</LSTag>, you can make a DC [1] Constitution saving throw. If you succeed, you drop to 1 hit point instead. Each time you use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5. When you finish a short or long rest, the DC resets to 10.
Will cause a stack of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE_FRENZY_BURNOUT">Frenzied Strain</LSTag> on the barbarian.
